==Japanese==

===Kanji===
{{ja-kanji|grade=n|rs=鳥02}}

# [[pigeon]], [[dove]]
# {{qualifier|in compounds}} to [[gather]] [[together]] {{qualifier|from the way that pigeons flock together}}

====Readings====
{{ja-readings
|goon=[[く]] (ku)
|kanon=[[きゅう]] (kyū), {{qualifier|historical}} [[きう]] (kiu)
|kun=[[はと]] (hato)
|nanori=[[やす]] (yasu)
}}

====Compounds====
{{der-top|Compounds}}
* {{ja-r|鳩居|きゅうきょ}}: a [[pigeon]] in a [[magpie]]'s [[nest]]; [[living]] in a [[rented]] [[house]] or [[apartment]]
* {{ja-r|鳩合|きゅうごう}}: [[flock]]ing together
* {{ja-r|鳩舎|きゅうしゃ}}: a [[dovecote]]
* {{ja-r|鳩車|きゅうしゃ}}: a [[pigeon]] [[cart]]: a kind of toy pigeon with wheels on it
* {{ja-r|鳩首|きゅうしゅ}}: putting heads together, [[consulting]] in a group
{{der-bottom}}

===Etymology===
<div style="float:right;">
{{wikipedia|lang=ja}}
{{wikipedia|Columba (genus)}}
[[File:Wood_pigeon_(male).jpg|thumb|250px|{{PAGENAME}} (''hato''): a '''[[pigeon]]''', a '''[[dove]]'''.]]
</div>
{{ja-kanjitab|はと|yomi=k}}
Possibly [[onomatopoeia]] from the ''hatahata'' sound of a dove or pigeon's wings in flight.

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|はと|acc=1|acc_ref=NHK,DJR,SMK5}}

===Alternative forms===
* {{ja-l|鴿}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|はと|ハト}}

# a [[pigeon]], a [[dove]]: a [[bird]] of [[genus]] [[Columba]]

====Usage notes====
{{U:ja:biology|ハト}}

====Idioms====
{{der-top|Idioms}}
* {{ja-r|鳩が豆鉄砲を食ったよう|はと が まめてっぽう を くった よう}}: “like a pigeon that ate a peashooter” → [[dumbfounded]], [[taken by surprise]]
{{der-bottom}}

====Derived terms====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|鳩車|はとぐるま}}: a [[pigeon]] [[cart]]: a kind of toy pigeon with wheels on it
* {{ja-r|鳩小屋|はとごや}}: a [[dovecote]]
* {{ja-r|鳩根性|はと こんじょう}}: “pigeon-spirited” → appearing [[composed]] while [[harbor#Verb|harboring]] [[resentment]]
* {{ja-r|鳩座|^はと-ざ}}: the [[Dove]] or [[Columba]] [[constellation]]
* {{ja-r|鳩酒|はとざけ}}: an old kind of [[medicine]], wherein a pigeon would be tenderized and the bones broken, then the whole carcass would be covered in [[sake]] and [[miso]] and [[stewed]], purportedly used to treat back pain and poor circulation in the extremities
* {{ja-r|鳩染|はとぞめ}}: “pigeon dyeing” → [[dyeing]], or something [[dyed]], in the colors of the [[turtledove]] or [[Japanese green pigeon]]
* {{ja-r|鳩派|はとは}}: {{qualifier|politics}} the [[dove]]s {{qualifier|proponents of peace; as opposed to the [[hawk]]s, proponents of war}}
* {{ja-r|鳩羽色|はとばいろ}}: “pigeon-wing color” → a dark blue-gray
* {{ja-r|鳩笛|はとぶえ}}: a [[pigeon]] [[flute]]: a flute used to [[imitate]] the call of the dove
* {{ja-r|鳩吹|はとふき}}: a [[dove]] [[call]], a [[lure]] to [[imitate]] the call of the dove
* {{ja-r|鳩吹く|はとふく}}: to make a [[dove]] [[call]], such as by blowing a kind of whistle formed by one's cupped hands
* {{ja-r|鳩麦|はとむぎ}}: “pigeon barley” → [[Job's tears]], [[tear grass]]
* {{ja-r|鳩胸|はとむね}}: [[pigeon]]-[[breasted]] {{qualifier|similar to the way a pigeon's chest is puffed out}}; {{qualifier|medical}} [[pectus carinatum]]
{{der-bottom}}
